	<item>
		<title>New FCC Rules You Really Should Know</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/new-fcc-rules-you-really-should-know/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 20 Oct 2013 23:08:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://mykaarma.com/wp/?p=379</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[New FCC guidelines and rules for operating under the Telephone Consumer Protection Act (TCPA) were published in February 2012, and businesses were given 18 months to comply with these rules, which took effect on October 16, 2013. We have has reviewed the rule changes over the past 18 months, and how they effect myKaarma, and have taken measures to improve compliance with the rules.

It is important to note that the TCPA and these latest FCC rules are designed to regulate telemarketing, particularly unsolicited telemarketing phone calls. Since wireless or cell phones may be charged for incoming calls (or text messages) the rules are particularly strict for telemarketing to wireless phones.

The full report and rules from the FCC are available here.

What is most important for myKaarma customers is to be aware that myKaarma is not intended to be used as a telemarketing platform, and should not be used as such. By providing only commercial informational messages to consumers through myKaarma, the system is exempt for the harsh requirements against telemarketers. Specifically, the new rules include an exemption if a call “Is made for a commercial purpose but does not include or introduce an advertisement or constitute telemarketing;” [see FCC rules page 31 2(a)(3)(iii)] Among other examples of informational calls included in the FCC ruling are “appointment reminders” and “service status” messages. Since existing repair orders are by definition not initiated at the time of the phone call or text message, informational calls including approvals are acceptable and exempt from the telemarketing requirements.

We here at myKaarma, do not participate in telemarketing solicitation calls or mass marketing texting, therefore the October 16, 2013, TCPA rules do not apply and the current FCC rules for calling cell phones remain in place. With these rules informational and non-solicitation texts require “prior express consent” and the pre October 16th rules require that a customer’s “prior express consent” may be either written or verbal. With the myKaarma application by getting the customer’s approval to receive a “Welcome Text” this assures the customer’s opt-in and the “Welcome Text” gives the customer the opt-out procedure as well.

The attached PDF outlines myKaarma’s usage guidelines that specifically state that the system should not be used outside of an individual service experience. Each individual customer service experience may include follow-up messages to the customer related to that service. Follow-up questions could be an inquiry to the customer regarding any questions about the recent service that the customer might have. With customer follow up as a requirement with most manufacturer customer service surveys a text or e-mail with specific follow-up questions regarding the service performed, such as “do you still hear the rattle noise when you make a right turn?” or “how’s the new transmission working for you?”, are certainly appropriate usage.

<button id="tcpaDownload" type="button" onclick="window.open('//mykaarma.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/myKaarmaBestPracticesforTextMessaging-Whitepaper.pdf');" class="btn btn-primary"><img src="//mykaarma.com/wp/wp-content/themes/kaarma/images/fileDownload.svg" style="height:20pt;width:20pt;margin-right:5pt;"> Download</button>

Usage guidelines for myKaarma, are incorporated into the initial sign-in process for all service adviser users, and are available within the myKaarma app as an online reference for them at any time.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>4 &quot;Write It Right&quot; Tips To Car Repair</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/4-write-it-right-tips-to-car-repair/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 29 Oct 2013 16:19:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://mykaarma.com/wp/?p=385</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[In today’s world where everyone has their lawyer on speed dial it is more important than ever to make sure you are crossing your T’s and dotting your I’s when it comes to car repair. However, in all honesty, the threat of being sued should not be your motivation for making sure that your customer’s service was accurate and transparent. We all know that a bad Yelp review or a call to Corporate can do far worse damage than a small claims law suit against your dealership because a husband doesn’t like the service his wife authorized on the family SUV. As you know, The California State B.A.R. is on it to make sure that you aren’t screwing your customer’s out of every last dime and nickel that they own. Luckily enough for you they give you guidelines that (If you follow them) are general best practices for keeping your customers happy, which should be your main priority given that studies have shown that when a person has a bad experience at a Dealership they tell ON AVERAGE 9-15 other people about that bad experience. Let’s get to the key points of the B.A.R’s Guide to Automotive Repair:
<ul>
 	<li>Keep the customer informed</li>
 	<li>Perform only the repairs that have been authorized</li>
 	<li>Maintain a written record of all work performed and parts supplied</li>
 	<li>Give copies of estimates and final invoices to the customer</li>
</ul>
I consider these guidelines similar to how a doctor operates his medical practice. A doctor can’t be expected to be right about his diagnosis 100% of the time or know exactly how each medicine will react in a every person’s body. However, what he can be expected to do is accurately inform his patients about the results of his tests, why more tests are needed, or why certain results are important while others are not. The same applies for your Service Department, while your customer won’t expect for you to give them service for free or be able to completely fix their car in a absurdly short amount of time, they will expect to know what is going on with their car and why they were charged a certain price. It is possible to be excellent at hitting all the Guidelines of the “Write It Right” booklet, with just the basic technology that people have used for years, i.e. the telephone, but by using the best practices of the Kaarma Software you can stream line those processes to help accommodate your customers. Here’s how the Kaarma Best Practices Apply:
<h5>Keep the Customer Informed</h5>
This one is the most obvious. While many of you got along just fine with only the telephone at your disposal, Kaarma Texting and Emailing gives you more options to connect with your 21st century customer. Sure, there are still loads of customers who just use the telephone, but the key is now they don’t have to, by starting the communication connection with your customer via text they don’t have to go in and listen to your voicemail. Also, studies show that 97% of all Text Messages are opened within 15 minutes of it being delivered, so regardless of whether or not your customer responds to your text, if you let them know you’ll be texting them, odds are they will see it and appreciate it.
<h5>Perform only the Repairs that have Been Authorized</h5>
Now, we can’t help you not to just go ahead and bill your customers for work they did not accept, you’re on your own with that, but we can help you not only get that authorization, but keep record of it. Look at it this way; most of the means of communication leave you in a position of a dispute being “your word against the customer” which we know the customer ends up always being right. So if you want to get credit for that sale make sure to Text, Email, or Call in your authorizations for additional work through Kaarma to make sure that it is logged. By the way, the average time it takes for approval for additional work by Text in Kaarma is 9 minutes…
<h5>Record All Work Done</h5>
This step is self-explanatory for some obvious reasons, but for one reason that may not be as obvious, if you keep track of all the work done to your customer’s car then you have things to upsell on next time. Also, if (as a service advisor) you keep that link to your customers in Kaarma, not only can you utilize their previous service history, but make sure that they come back to YOU for their next service.
<h5>Give Copies of Estimates and Invoice to Your Customers</h5>
You may be saying, “Of course we do this! Every customer gets a copy of their RO!” Then ask yourself how many receipts for random transactions you’ve saved in the past year? Or how many of them end up crumpled up in your pocket never to be seen again? RO’s and Invoices are no different, which is why it is vital to send your customers an electronic copy of their receipt. If you have Kaarma’s Mobile Payment Service you already do this when you send your customer a link to pay, but for those of you who only use Kaarma DirectConnect, ask your customers if they’d like a copy by email and easily attach it to an email out to your customers. This practice helps your customers find their invoice, while giving you a good excuse to follow up to make sure they give a good CSI score for the Dealership.

We have provided a link to a copy of the <a href="http://www.bar.ca.gov/80_BARResources/ftp/pdfdocs/WriteItRight.pdf" target="_blank">Bar’s Write it Right Guide to Auto Repair</a>.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[4 "Write It Right" Tips To Car Repair]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Welcome!</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/welcome/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 12 Jan 2013 02:53:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[kevin.farina]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://mykaarma.com/wp/?p=421</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Welcome to Insights!  If you are reading this you are one of the few initial readers of the Kaarma Blog or as we like to call it, so celebrations are in order!  Go pop a beer; relax, because we are here to make your life easier.  The goal of Insights is to provide you with useful ideas and content to help your Service Drive run as efficiently as possible.  Our team has hundreds of years of combined automotive experience, but we do not consider ourselves the “Be All End All” of service knowledge, rather we pride ourselves on having an ear for the problems of our customers.

At Kaarma, we believe that listening to our customers and learning how they work gives us the best understanding of how to make our products.  Along with the knowledge we gain to improve the Kaarma products, we pick up a lot of handy information that would help progress any Service Drive.  We see it as our duty to pass along what we learn because there are problems in every drive that need attention and less problems equals more money in your pocket.  The desire to help and advance the Auto Industry is why I started Kaarma because I envision an experience in the Service Drive that is on par if not equal to the ease with which a company like Amazon caters to their users.  If you are an Amazon buff, like myself, you know exactly what I am talking about, and if you don’t use Amazon, you likely can think of a business that you use all the time that is just…easy.  Plain and simple.  You go there, you get what you want, you pay for it, and you are done. For me, that experience is Amazon, and I believe my experience there to be so easy that I can’t help myself but go back for more.

My wife complains on a daily basis about the packages that litter our doorstep, and they are not even important things, not products I need or have researched for hours.  Instead, they are a pair of scissors or a new cable for my iPad, items that popped into my head just long enough for me to take that two-step process to get the package right to my door in less than a week.  Now, I’m not saying that your Service Drive will ever be held to the expectations that companies such as Amazon have set, because we all know that a car takes time and care.  There cannot be such a thing as “one-click check out” for a complicated machine that, more often than not, is the average American’s second biggest expense (only behind a house).  But what there can be is a frictionless, open, and simple practice that makes it so your customers can’t help but come back for even the most basic expenses.

Do the Kaarma Products have anything to do with all of this?  Well they do and they don’t.  Sometimes our Insights will be based around trends that we notice in Kaarma that can help you adapt to the changing needs of your customers.  Other Insights may just be some nugget of knowledge one of the Kaarma Team picked up working on the Service Drive that day that has absolutely nothing to do with Texting, Scheduling Appointments, or Mobile Payments.  We are OK with this.  In fact, we are more than ok with this.  Why?  Because your world doesn’t revolve around Kaarma and we would never presume that our software is what makes or breaks a Service Drive.  All we can do as a company is hope to best serve your interests, which is best serving your customers interests.

So if you are looking for some ways to improve your Service Drive, wondering what two questions your customers want answered by text, or if you want to just sit back and learn something new.  We will be here.  If you don’t find it worthwhile then don’t read it.  We won’t take offense.  We would actually rather you tell us so we can tailor our Insights to better suit you. We aren’t in business to tell you what you can’t do, rather we are here to do what we do best:  Listen, Learn, and Create.

Ujj Nath – CEO]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>What you should be doing to improve your service drive</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/what-you-should-be-doing-to-improve-your-service-drive/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 12 Nov 2014 03:02:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[kevin.farina]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://mykaarma.com/wp/?p=431</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As General Manager for a large Volkswagen Dealership in Los Angeles for over 15 years, I learned a thing or two about operating a Service Drive.  A lot of the things I learned however came because of my commitment to trying different strategies to achieve the goals I wanted for the dealership.  Therefore, whenever I approached a problem in my dealership I asked myself the different ways I could solve that issue to get the desired end result and then I would weigh the pros and cons of each solution.  The key to this strategy though, is making sure that you set measurement standards for any project that you implement into the dealership.  Because if I merely just made a process change without any type of benchmark to compare my results to after I was done evaluating the change, then how could I know if the initiative was successful?

This ideology not only comes in handy when implementing new strategies in the Dealership, but also for the existing processes as well.  My experiences with the Service Drive varied over the many years, but one situation sticks out in my mind over all the others to show that measuring your results in order to meet a goal truly does affect the performance of your Fixed Ops department.

Here it goes…

One day, the service director came to me with a proposal to purchase a major piece of equipment to check for proper alignment specs in the service drive. The equipment seemed intriguing to say the least but it cost $40,000 and to make sure I got a return on my investment I started to figure out how much this alignment machine would really be worth to our Service Department.

So, I asked how many alignments we are currently doing per month. It turns out that on average we had been doing fifty-six (56) alignments per month. Based on this the service director and I agreed that we needed to improve our concentration on vehicles that came in for service needing an alignment. We also agreed that the new equipment would obviously greatly improve our performance. With the fact that the equipment was $40,000 and if we did not improve the workshops focus on the vehicles that need alignment it could likely become a $40,000 boondoggle.

With all of this determined the service director and I struck a bargain.  If the workshop did a total of one-hundred-twelve (112) alignments in the next thirty days we would buy the equipment. Well this led to an increased concentration during the advisors walk-around inspection on the condition and visible wear of each individual vehicles tires. It also led to the service director checking on how many alignments we were doing each day. Frankly, it was more like how many each hour. This included posting the results day by day for the entire workshop to see.

To make a long story short all of this led to the workshop doing two-hundred-sixty-seven (267) alignments during the thirty-day period.

After we had tallied up all of the alignments for that 30 day period, the service director was completely shocked, he realized that he liked the sound of a big expensive alignment machine that could crank out alignments like Peyton Manning does touchdowns.  However, the end goal of the machine would really be to increase the amount of alignments that we were doing in our Service Drive and just by really focusing on improving our inspection process we saw a 500% increase in our alignment revenues.

The moral of this story is that before you go ahead and make a decision to alter the way you operate in your Service Drive, take a second and figure out the results of your current process then create a benchmark to improve those results with your new project.  I have no doubt that you will find your own “alignment machine” scenario in your Service Drive.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[What You Should Be Doing to Improve Your Service Drive]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>431</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2014-11-12 03:02:15]]></wp:post_date>

		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>

	<item>
		<title>How not using mobile payments can cost your dealership up to $5,000</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/how-not-using-mobile-payments-can-cost-your-dealership-5000/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 12 Jan 2015 03:03:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[kevin.farina]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://mykaarma.com/wp/?p=433</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Imagine the following scenario in your head:

1)  Son brings car in for repair work.

2)  Calls in his Dad’s Credit Card number over the phone to pay for the bill.

3)  The Dad see’s a $5,000 dollar charge on his credit card that he did not approve.

4)  Dad issues a “chargeback” and the Dealership pays the price.

This situation is not out of the ordinary and I’m sure just reading this you can think of a handful of similar instances just off the top of your head.  Now, I’m going to tell you the full story and how the whole thing could have been avoided.

(All names and places have been edited to protect confidentiality)

Meet Jim.  Jim is a Dad just like myself and all you Dad’s out there. Also, Jim is a customer at Bob’s Dealership, except he doesn’t know it yet.  One day,  Jim looks at his credit card bill and sees a whopping $5,000 charge on his statement from Bob’s Dealership and he has no idea how it got there, so just like any responsible Dad he freaks out and disputes the charge.  It turns out, Jim jr. had gone to town with repairs on Jim Sr.’s mini-van  one day.  So needless to say, Jim was none too pleased to see these charges on his account when he had never told his son that it was ok to rack up such a nicely figured bill.

Usually this would be Jim’s problem if his son had physically used the credit card, but in this case he did not.  Turns out, Jim jr. had the credit card number on a slip of paper that he read to his Service Advisor over the phone.  All you Dealers out there should be shaking your head, because you know this happens all the time.  So since Bob’s Service Advisor took the payment 1) over the phone and 2) without a credit card authorization form, Bob’s dealership is really up the creek without a paddle on this one.

This issue could have been avoided by getting the credit card authorization form from Jim Jr., which would have authorized the dealership to make such a charge.  However, doing all the work to get the form correctly signed, faxed and filled out would waste tons of Dealership time.  Bob’s Service Advisor figured, what the heck? I’m sure it’s fine right?  Wrong.  Clearly shown by the now unpaid bill of $5,000.

These problems can also be avoided by this wonderful thing called Mobile Payments, which are considered a type of eCommerce Transactions.  If Bob’s Dealership had sent Jim Jr. a Mobile Payment Request where he could input the credit card information and pay for the work completed, then the Dealership would be off the hook.

Lucky enough for us, eCommerce transactions are not bound by the normal rules of credit card processing, Jim Jr. could charge any amount of dollars on the internet with his Dad’s credit card and unless Jim Sr. wants to press criminal charges against his son, there is nothing he can do about it.

So if the Service Advisor had merely thought to send Jim Jr. a Mobile Payment, the Dealership would have all $5,000 of the money that the Dealership was rightfully owed.

Also as an added benefit, with a Mobile Payment sent to the customer in advance, you allow them the courtesy of looking at the invoice, verifying that it is correct, while saving an electronic copy for their records.  Keep in mind, that if the consumer does show up at the Dealership and has to ask the cashier to clarify any of the line items.. you are already in trouble. The poor cashier will always have a standard response to the question - “Let me call the Service Advisor to clarify” and the wait starts.

The moral of this story is to make sure that your Dealership is using all 21st century means necessary to protect itself from situations like the one described above.  In an increasingly connected society, people tend to dispute first and ask questions later.  So if you can guard against unreasonable disputes while also letting your customers view their invoice before they come in to the dealership.  Then the question is no longer, “Why Mobile Payments?”,but “Why Not Mobile Payments?”]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[How Not Using Mobile Payments Can Cost Your Dealership $5,000]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>433</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2015-01-12 03:03:11]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2015-01-12 03:03:11]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[how-not-using-mobile-payments-can-cost-your-dealership-5000]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>

		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1646]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Interview with Chris Barthel - Head of Fixed Operations for the Conant Automotive Group</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/interview-with-chris-barthel-head-of-fixed-operations-for-the-conant-automotive-group/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 12 Nov 2014 11:04:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[kevin.farina]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://mykaarma.com/wp/?p=435</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Welcome to the Kaarma Interview Series, in these monthly posts I will be interviewing a current Kaarma customer on different topics that come up in the Service Drive.  Our first interview is with Conant Automotive Group Director of Fixed Operations, Chris Barthel.  Chris runs Fixed Operations for all 12 C.A.R. Group Dealerships across the nation and is always looking for ways to improve his service drive.  In this initial interview we talked about some of his biggest challenges running Fixed Ops for one of the largest Dealer Groups in the nation. Below I’ve given you a transcript of our conversation.  Enjoy!
<h4>What would you say is the biggest challenge that you face?</h4>
I would say the biggest challenge that we face on a day to day basis is finding the right people to work at the C.A.R. group.  We believe that hiring the right people to begin with is really the key to making our business be successful over the long term.  Also, you want to make sure that if you are going to take all the time to train somebody on how you operate then they should be willing to learn and be open to the process you have at the dealership.
<h4>How do you go about making sure you find the right people?</h4>
Well first of all I personally interview every Service Adviser that we hire at the C.A.R. Group.  But most of the time I don’t have to do that much.  I set up a system here culturally that lets my Service Managers and Human Resources really know what we are looking for in terms of experience, personality, work ethic, etc.  So those people take it upon themselves to make sure that a potential new hire fits that criteria before I even get to interview the person.
<h4>What do you look for in a new service adviser?</h4>
Like most everyone out there I look at the general personality traits that everyone wants to hire, friendly, hard working, open minded, etc.  However, I don’t necessarily want to hire someone with automotive experience.  If anything, I almost prefer someone without automotive experience because they don’t have any preconceived ideas of how a dealership should operate.  People who come from other Customer Service oriented industries, like retail for example, are great candidates to work in the Service Drive because they already know how to interact with a customer.  Customer Service is something that is hard to teach, we can easily train someone how to work in a Service Drive, but having the personality to deal with a customer respectfully and thoughtfully when its not easy to do so, is a big plus.
<h4>Would you say that you put more responsibility on your Service Advisers than most Dealerships?</h4>
Every dealership has different processes that work for them.  For the C.A.R. Group specifically, I like to put a lot of responsibility on my Service Advisers as well as my Service Managers to make sure that they are operating in a way that is customer centric.  I like to give my Service Managers as much flexibility as possible because I need them to be able to walk the dealership and be vocal so that I can be comfortable that things are running smoothly.  As a multi-dealer group its not reasonable for me to micro manage my Managers or my Advisers, nor would I want to.  Also, as part of the culture we make sure that Service Advisers handle all aspects of the interaction with the customer  which is why we moved to a self-cashiering model in all the C.A.R. Group stores.
<h4>So you think a Self-Cashiering model is more beneficial to the Service Department as a whole?</h4>
Definitely. Any Dealership will tell you the problems that having a cashier can cause for you in terms of customer satisfaction.  We wanted to make sure that our Service Advisers could see the customer interaction through until the end to make sure that there were no gaps in the customer service experience.  When the customer goes to the cashier, all the work you did making sure they were happy until that point can go out the door when the customer wants to ask a question about their bill that the cashier does not know.  So when we moved to self-cashiering we saw a big boost in Customer Satisfaction and we were also able to reallocate our cashiers to do other tasks to benefit the dealership.

That's it for our first interview with Chris Barthel.  What are your biggest challenges in the dealership?  Comment below on the issues you face or what you thought of Chris's Interview!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Candid Interview with Chris Barthel - Head of Fixed Ops for the Conant Automotive Group]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>myKaarma at #NADA2016</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/mykaarma-at-nada2016/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 22:35:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://mykaarma.com/?p=1254</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Thank you to everyone at NADA and all of those that came to our booth. We had fun showing you how to earn back time at your dealership. We hope we showed you how we can improve your service drive and look forward to seeing you in the future.

<div class="center">[gallery type="rectangular" link="none" size="medium" ids="1263,1256,1258,1255,1259,1261,1260,1267,1265,1264,1266,1262,1257"]</div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>myKaarma named official platform BMW</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/mykaarma-named-official-platform-for-bmw/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 21 Jul 2016 20:02:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ujj.nath@mykaarma.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://mykaarma.com/?p=1798</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

<strong>myKaarma named official communications and payments supplier for BMW</strong>


LONG BEACH, CA - July 20, 2016 - myKaarma, the cloud-based software company for car dealerships, is pleased to announce their selection as the preferred communication and payment platform for BMW. They were named as an official partner for Mercedes-Benz USA in 2015, and operate the Digital Service Drive program on their behalf.

The myKaarma platform saves automotive dealership service departments time and money by boosting service advisor productivity, reducing loaner car days, and minimizing authorization disputes. Dealers also see improvements in their customer retention rates by increasing their CSI (Customer Satisfaction Index). Studies conducted by myKaarma have shown that users who sent updates through the platform have higher average CSI score of over 200 points than those who did not.

ABOUT THE COMPANY
myKaarma is a cloud-based software company for automotive dealerships that focuses on enhancing the retail and service department experience. The myKaarma platform gives dealers the ability to offer 21st Century technology, through digital conversations and smart payment systems, to their customers.

myKaarma, founded in 2010, is located in Los Angeles, California.

MEDIA CONTACT
Thomas Ross
562.349.1356
tom.ross@mykaarma.com

www.mykaarma.com
#myKaarma]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>myKaarma receives a top tier NPS score of 82.</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/mykaarma-receives-top-tier-nps-score-82/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 21 Jul 2016 20:00:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ujj.nath@mykaarma.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://mykaarma.com/?p=1802</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We are pleased to share the results of our first-ever Net Promoter Score (NPS®) survey that we conducted earlier this month. <strong>We received a NPS® score of 82.</strong> The mark far exceeds the benchmark of 25 for the technology industry. This places us on par with such customer service leaders like Apple (76 NPS), Costco (78 NPS) and USAA (80 NPS). 86% of our clients rated their satisfaction with myKaarma, a 9 or 10 (Promoters), we saw “promoters” out-gaining “detractors” by a 20:1 margin. This means a far greater number of you would refer us vs. those who would not. Thank you to our valued customers!
<p style="text-align: center;"><img class="alignnone" src="https://gallery.mailchimp.com/83a67b42a4b7ba59bfa3743eb/images/3414d949-73cd-40f6-ba8b-e88f0d07b53b.png" width="800" height="481" /></p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Slashing voice rates by another 40%</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/slashing-voice-rates-another-40/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 21 Jul 2016 19:56:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ujj.nath@mykaarma.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://mykaarma.com/?p=1807</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[For the third time in six months, we are pleased to announce that we are <strong>lowering our voice-call rate from 4.5¢ to 2.9¢ per minutes</strong>, effective June 1st, 2016. Your savings will be reflected in your July 2016 statement. In less than six months, we have reduced our rates from 7¢ per min to 2.9¢ per minute. Our continued growth allows us to leverage our volume to negotiate better rates from our providers. We strongly believe in passing on the savings to our customers. myKaarma voice-calling feature is now cheaper… for you! Look out for other savings going forward...

<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1808" src="http://mykaarma.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/myKaarma-phone.jpeg" alt="myKaarma phone" width="191" height="100" />]]></content:encoded>

We love our customers and we strive every day to make their jobs easier and their customers happier. A couple pieces of feedback our support team received last month: "LeAnn is fantastic, as is everyone I have spoken with at myKaarma. I haven't had better customer service with any other vendor." from Steve S. "David and LeAnn are spectacular in their jobs. They both deserve champagne and bonuses." from Clay P.</span></span></div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>myKaarma Net Promoter Score Survey Results</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/mykaarma-net-promoter-score-survey-results/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 02 Aug 2016 18:23:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ujj.nath@mykaarma.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://mykaarma.com/?p=1875</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We are pleased to share the results of our first-ever Net Promoter Score (NPS®) survey that we conducted this summer. <strong>You gave us a NPS® score of 82.</strong> The mark far exceeds the benchmark of 25 for the technology industry. This places us on par with such customer service leaders like Apple (76 NPS), Costco (78 NPS) and USAA (80 NPS).  <strong>Thank you our valued customers!</strong>

<img src="https://gallery.mailchimp.com/83a67b42a4b7ba59bfa3743eb/images/3414d949-73cd-40f6-ba8b-e88f0d07b53b.png" />

Higher productivity=higher profits. We asked how much more productive you were since myKaarma and results showed an average of <strong>71% increase in productivity!</strong>

<img src="https://gallery.mailchimp.com/83a67b42a4b7ba59bfa3743eb/images/76e975a2-d9ee-4170-ad4f-598133219f28.png" />

<strong>77% of you said that myKaarma improved your customer retention rates</strong> since signing up. Better retention equals better profits.

<img src="https://gallery.mailchimp.com/83a67b42a4b7ba59bfa3743eb/images/ee1507ab-cd90-44d7-90ee-cd48686f9e00.png" />

<strong>98% of you said that myKaarma has improved your communication</strong> with your customers.  Informed customers equals happy customers.

<img src="https://gallery.mailchimp.com/83a67b42a4b7ba59bfa3743eb/images/e4589c0c-721a-4ef2-b251-90275c247548.png" />

Save money, save stress. <strong>82% of you said that myKaarma helped reduce authorization disputes</strong> since signing up.

<img src="https://gallery.mailchimp.com/83a67b42a4b7ba59bfa3743eb/images/edcea86f-b8e7-4ae9-a8be-4c2ca883351a.png" />]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Our myKaarma customers rate us highly in NPS survey.]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="retention"><![CDATA[retention]]></category>

		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[6]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_content_score]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[30]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_focuskeywords]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[[]]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_primary_category]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1890]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_focuskw_text_input]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Net Promoter Score]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_focuskw]]></wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_linkdex]]></wp:meta_key>

		<wp:postmeta>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>New Product News -- Sept 2016</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/new-product-news-at-mykaarma/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 07 Sep 2016 23:51:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ujj.nath@mykaarma.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://mykaarma.com/?p=1940</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="font-weight: 400;">We have a lot happening here at myKaarma and we are excited to share with you several new features we have rolled out as part of the myKaarma platform.</span>
<div class="container" style="padding: 50pt 0 0 0;">
<div class="col-sm-11">
<h5 class="text-center"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 20pt;">Out-of-Office</span></h5>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><img class="center wp-image-1996 img-responsive" style="padding: 5pt 0 0 0;" src="http://mykaarma.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Screen-Shot-2016-09-08-at-2.50.22-PM_censored.jpg" alt="internal-communiation-new" width="548" height="329" />
<span style="font-weight: 400;">With this capability, any myKaarma user at the dealership is able to auto-reply, auto-delegate, or auto-forward his/her voice calls, text messages, and emails with just a few clicks. This function lets the Guests know that their Advisor is not available and seamlessly passes the baton to a fellow Service Advisor.</span></p>

</div>
</div>
<div class="container" style="padding: 50pt 0 0 0;">
<div class="col-sm-11">
<h5 class="text-center"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 20pt;">Internal Communications</span></h5>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><img class="center wp-image-1996 img-responsive" style="padding: 5pt 0 0 0;" src="http://mykaarma.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Internal-Communiation-NEW-6-300x180.png" alt="internal-communiation-new" width="548" height="329" />
<span style="font-weight: 400;">This feature allows the Service Advisor to communicate internally with  other key members of the dealership and external partners while still on the myKaarma application.  The advisor has the benefit of seeing all communications - both internal and external - in one conversation. The Internal Communications feature also eliminates noisy walkie-talkies, long walks to find technicians, locating the much-needed shuttle driver,  and playing phone tag with OEM reps.</span></p>

</div>
</div>
<div class="container" style="padding: 50pt 0 0 0;">
<div class="col-sm-11">
<h5 class="text-center"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 20pt;">Chip and PIN Payments</span></h5>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><img class="center size-medium wp-image-1945 img-responsive" style="padding: 5pt 0 0 0;" src="http://mykaarma.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/EMV-swiper-300x151.png" alt="EMV swiper" width="300" height="151" />
<span style="font-weight: 400;">Card issuers have rolled out new requirements for businesses to adopt EMV card readers in order to start accepting chip cards. myKaarma swipers support both kinds of these new smart cards:  chip-and-PIN and chip-and-signature.   Since American Express, Mastercard, and Visa have shifted the liability for counterfeit card-present transactions to the merchant, having EMV swipers at your dealership can help protect you from costly chargebacks.</span></p>

</div>
</div>
<div class="container" style="padding: 50pt 0 0 0;">
<div class="col-sm-11">
<h5 class="text-center"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 20pt;">Check and Cash</span></h5>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">myKaarma Payments now let you accept cash and check through the same system where you are processing credit and debit card transactions. This allows you to keep all tender types in one single closing report for your team to reconcile easily on a daily basis.  As the famous saying goes, “Time saved is money earned”.</span></p>

</div>
</div>
<div class="container" style="padding: 50pt 0 0 0;">
<div class="col-sm-11">
<h5 class="text-center"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 20pt;">Text-to-Text Forwarding</span></h5>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><img class="center size-medium wp-image-1946 img-responsive" style="padding: 5pt 0 0 0;" src="http://mykaarma.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Text-2-text-168x300.png" alt="Text 2 text" width="168" height="300" />
<span style="font-weight: 400;">This feature allows every text message to be forwarded to your Service Advisor’s cell phone through a blind-pool of numbers.  The advisor can then reply to the text message (even if he/she is not near the myKaarma app), walk to the repair bay, take pictures, and text them back to the Guest.  Calling the forwarded phone number connects you directly to the Guest’s telephone number.  All of this still honors the myKaarma "single number" concept and allows  all communication  to be routed through the main number that has been assigned to for your dealership.</span></p>

</div>
</div>
<div class="container" style="padding: 50pt 0 0 0;">
<div class="col-sm-11">
<h5 class="text-center"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 20pt;">Electronic Signature Capture</span></h5>
<div class="row">
<div class="col-sm-5 col-xs-6"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1947 img-responsive" style="padding: 10pt 0; float: right;" src="http://mykaarma.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/e-sig-142x300.png" alt="e-sig" width="142" height="300" /></div>
<div class="col-sm-7 col-xs-6"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1948 img-responsive" style="padding: 10pt 0; float: left;" src="http://mykaarma.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/e-isg-2-300x139.png" alt="e isg 2" width="300" height="139" /></div>
</div>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">myKaarma’s new electronic signature capture solution allows the dealership to get electronic signatures on repair orders for the dealership before the customer comes in to pick up his/her  vehicle.  These signed documents are then stored in myKaarma for easy access by the dealership for warranty review or dispute resolution purposes.  The signing of these documents online allows for an even simpler check-out experience for the customer while also saving time and money in collecting and storing physical repair orders with signatures.</span></p>

</div>
</div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[New Product News -- Sept 2016
Check out all the new features we have recently launched.]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>myKaarma now offers FREE unlimited text messaging!</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/mykaarma-now-offers-free-unlimited-text-messaging/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 03 Oct 2016 17:31:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ujj.nath@mykaarma.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://mykaarma.com/?p=2124</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="font-weight: 400;">We are pleased to announce that we have <strong>lowered our Text rate from 1.0¢ per message to 0.0¢ per message*</strong>, effective October 1st, 2016. Now you have the ability to use unlimited free text messages to communicate with your customers. Your savings will be reflected in your <span style="text-decoration: underline;">November 2016 statement</span>.</span>

Remember all messages (text, voice, email) are recorded and stored for seven years. Use the myKaarma app and totally eliminate authorization disputes.

<i><span style="font-weight: 400;">Our continued growth allows us to leverage our volume to negotiate better rates from our providers. We strongly believe in passing on the savings to you, our valued customer.</span></i>

&nbsp;

<p style="font-size:10pt;">*New rooftops or departments like BDC may carry separate per department per month fees, but no additional charges for the actual text usage</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[myKaarma now offers free Unlimited Text Messaging.]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2124</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2016-10-03 10:31:37]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2016-10-03 17:31:37]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[mykaarma-now-offers-free-unlimited-text-messaging]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>

		<category domain="category" nicename="mykaarma-news"><![CDATA[myKaarma News]]></category>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>myKaarma launches four new Innovations to their platform</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/innovation/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 31 Oct 2016 18:32:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ujj.nath@mykaarma.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://mykaarma.com/?p=2192</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<b>myKaarma adds Four New Innovations to Platform, Helps Further Improve  </b><b>Customer Interaction with Auto Dealer Service Departments</b>

<i><span style="font-weight: 400;">Leveraging 21st century communication software, myKaarma enables auto dealerships to provide service customers with a dramatically improved experience</span></i>

<b>LONG BEACH, Calif., October 31, 2016</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> -- myKaarma, the cloud based conversational commerce software that’s revolutionizing the auto service industry, today announced the addition of four new innovative features to its award winning platform. The new features are designed to help auto dealers further improve communication and interaction with their service customers.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">As a leader in Customer Interaction Management software for dealerships, myKaarma has developed the first ever conversational commerce solution optimized for auto dealer service customer’s needs. Using myKaarma, the service advisor can text or call the customer with one recognizable service department number, or email the customer through an easy-to-use platform on the desktop computer. All communication is recorded within myKaarma for future reference. When the service advisor is on break and the customer needs to get in contact, myKaarma “follow-me” technology sends the message to the service advisor’s smartphone, allowing them to reply even when not at their desk, while capturing the message in the cloud. Or the service advisor can delegate the message to another service advisor to handle. Instead of struggling to connect through phone tag, the advisor can update and get authorization from the customer in minutes. </span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">And, when the customer’s vehicle is done, a payment request is sent to that customer through the myKaarma app with a copy of their invoice, allowing the customer to verify their service and pay on their smartphone, tablet, or PC, all without logging into a website. With myKaarma there are no more lines or unanswered questions holding the customer up. It helps the service advisor get the customer through a simple, care-free service experience. As a result, d</span><span style="font-weight: 400;">ealers have realized additional benefits such as a <strong>$7,000 per month saving by reducing loaner car days</strong> and authorization disputes are almost entirely eliminated. They have also seen in some cases, <strong>a rise in CSI scores as much as 200 points. </strong></span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">In fact, in a survey conducted earlier this year, myKaarma dealers stated they were 71 percent more productive than prior to myKaarma. The new features: </span><b><i>Out-of-Office</i></b><span style="font-weight: 400;">, </span><b><i>Internal Communications</i></b><span style="font-weight: 400;">, </span><b><i>Check and Cash</i></b><span style="font-weight: 400;">, and </span><b><i>Chip and PIN payments</i></b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> are designed to further improve staff productivity and enhance the customer experience at the service department as follows:</span>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><i><strong>Out-of-Office:</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> The </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">Out-of-Office</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> feature now allows any myKaarma user to auto-reply, auto-delegate, or auto-forward voice calls, text messages, and emails with just a few clicks. It lets the customer know that their advisor is unavailable and seamlessly passes the baton to a fellow service advisor.</span></i></li>
</ul>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>Internal Communications</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>:</strong> This feature allows the service advisor to communicate internally with other key members of the dealership, as well as external partners, via text, voice, mobile app, without leaving the myKaarma application. This feature eliminates noisy walkie-talkies and long walks to find technicians or to locate the much-needed shuttle driver.</span></li>
</ul>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>Check and Cash Payments:</strong>  This feature allows the dealership to </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">accept cash and check </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">through the same system that processes credit and debit card transactions. It enables all payment types to appear in one single closing report with one-click auto-reconciliation. </span></li>
</ul>
<ul>
 	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>Chip and PIN Payments:</strong> Card issuers have rolled out new requirements for businesses to adopt EMV card readers in order to start accepting chip cards. myKaarma swipers support both kinds of these new smart cards: </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">chip-and-PIN and chip-and-signature</span><span style="font-weight: 400;">.</span></li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400;">“Customers want to interact with their regular service advisor; get real-time notification of any changes required with new ETAs; bypass ‘phone trees’ to reach their service advisor directly to get questions answered; easily review their invoice prior to payment to understand the charges; and be contacted after the visit to ensure satisfaction,” said Ujj Nath, CEO of myKaarma. </span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">“</span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We designed our platform to be the cleanest channel that connects customers with the dealer. The new additions to myKaarma enable our dealers to better leverage the customers’ communication of choice (Text, Email, or Voice) and maintain good communication with customers as all times. In addition, the app also offers multiple payment systems (Online, Mobile and Point-of-Sale) with auto-reconciliation that seamlessly integrates with the dealer’s DMS. It saves hours of accounting time for the dealership and </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">leads to higher CSI scores, improved customer retention and strong word-of-mouth advocacy from existing customers. And, most importantly, higher profits for the dealer,” Nath added.</span>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[myKaarma launches four exciting, new innovations]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2192</wp:post_id>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>R.I.P. CRM!</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/r-p-crm/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 07 Nov 2016 17:28:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ujj.nath@mykaarma.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://mykaarma.com/?p=2261</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[CRM as we know it is dead. Its sole purpose was to replace index cards and rolodexes with a more organized digital solution – one which helped salespeople more efficiently follow-up, track and manage conversations. However, in most cases, the ultimate beneficiary is the user, not the customer.

<span style="font-weight: 400;">In terms of communication, today’s world is filled with noise. So many businesses compete to communicate with and attract the attention of consumers. Ultimately none of these messages are received. Why? People have stopped listening. We are all tired of those unsolicited phone calls, email solicitations and direct mail. I am sure you throw them away, just like me. If the primary functionality of a CRM is to communicate with people, and those people have stopped listening to you, then it no longer serves much purpose. Yet an average dealer will spend north of $3K per month on this futile exercise. The people have voted and businesses are blocked from their digital and physical lives! They are fed up with intrusions upon their limited time. </span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">However, technology now provides a far superior way to communicate with people. Just like we evolved from note cards and rolodexes to CRMs, the next evolution is happening -- and the companies that pay attention are winning. Today’s consumers interact with and do business with companies that pay attention to their needs. Businesses that listen to and make it convenient for customers to do business will win. If you doubt this, simply consider how easy it is to spend money with Amazon. From “one-click” to “Dash” buttons – and now you can simply verbally tell Amazon Echo what you want -- you don’t even need to touch a computer, get up from the couch, or go anywhere. You can order a Hyundai delivered right to your front door for a test drive. You can complete the entire car buying process online and collect the vehicle from a vending machine. No humans required. </span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">It’s no longer about relationship management, it’s about managing interactions. Try it, improve your customer interactions by simply listening to and making it easier for your customers to do business with you. You should see increased sales and market share, along with unprecedented retention. Continue to communicate the same old way that you always have and your customers will find someone who WILL listen to them.</span>

&nbsp;
<div class="col-sm-4">[wpdevart_poll id="1" theme="1"]</div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Ring. Delete. Repeat.</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/ring-delete-repeat/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 14 Nov 2016 17:12:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ujj.nath@mykaarma.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://mykaarma.com/?p=2306</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="font-weight: 400;">How many times per day do you decline to answer your phone because you don’t know who is calling? How many pieces of mail a day do you throw away unopened on a daily basis? Are all the promotional mail pieces going straight into the trash can once a week? Well, do you think your customers act any differently?</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">Sure, you get some bites here and there and sometimes you sell more cars and make more gross than the cost of the phone calls or direct mail.  Perhaps you have a salesperson going down a prospect list and pounding the phones, calling people who are ignoring the call.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">Many people don’t even listen to voicemails anymore. Many don’t even set use their voicemails. And the emails that happen to sneak through a spam filter into an inbox get trashed as fast as a person can click delete – mostly before it is even read - or they get lost in the inbox clutter. Especially when the  customer didn’t request the information in the first place! And, with the sheer volume of emails, if the customer doesn’t see  your email arrive in the inbox, it  may well be on the second screen, out of view, and they never see it.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">But dealers keep sending thousands of emails and keep leaving those voicemails … and they keep being ignored by their customers!</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">If emails and voicemails are no longer effective, how are you supposed to communicate with your customers?</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">As a society, we have been conditioned to expect spam – both via voice and email – but many, especially millennials, still pay attention to one thing – text messages. In fact, over 98% of them are read - </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">and 90% are read within 30 seconds! If they’re relevant, they get a response. Texts are typically short, can be responded to quickly and without much interruption – they are convenient and less intrusive.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">If you want to sell a vehicle, or get through to a customer to recommend additional service, or get their approval for your service recommendations, I guarantee that calling someone while at work or enjoying dinner will get you their voicemail. And, in most cases, that templated email will only be read by the customer’s spam filter.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">Is it all about the process? Or should we be more concerned about making sure customer interaction actually occurs – that the communication is something the customer will actually respond to so a conversation can occur? </span>
<div class="col-sm-4" style="margin-top: 10pt;">[wpdevart_poll id="2" theme="1"]</div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Ring. Delete. Repeat.]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[software]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="text-messaging"><![CDATA[text messaging]]></category>

		</wp:postmeta>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Customer Service: Your Customers Aren’t Gonna Take It Anymore</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/customers-arent-gonna-take-anymore/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 21 Nov 2016 16:57:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ujj.nath@mykaarma.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://mykaarma.com/?p=2354</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>An Insight into Human-Centric Design</strong></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">One click ordering. Buy it now. Same day delivery. Dash buttons where all you have to do is press a button and the item is shipped. You can even place orders through Amazon’s Alexa with a voice command.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Businesses like Amazon have grown into hugely popular industry giants because they understand what customers want and when they want it. And, for the most part, they want it NOW!</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>DESIGN FOR CHANGE</strong></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Our society has transitioned to a self-service customer service model. Before that, customer service was handled in a human-only model, with bank tellers, cashiers, travel agents, and other similar service positions. Now, we can do all of our banking online: pay our bills, arrange for travel, and even go grocery shopping, completing the entire transaction with no need for human assistance. The reason these self-service opportunities exist is two-fold.  Firstly, it’s convenient for the customer and cost efficient for the business. Secondly, if a customer can accomplish all they need without an employee, that’s potentially one less employee on the payroll.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">However, occasionally the customer cannot accomplish all they need without some assistance. Despite the desire for instant gratification and self-service convenience, occasionally most customers will encounter a roadblock which cannot be handled with digital technology. They will need the help of an actual human being.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><img class="alignleft wp-image-2372" src="https://mykaarma.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/jikoda-quote-1.png" width="401" height="178" /></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">When those occasions arise, this transfer needs to be seamless for the customer, as they will probably be short on patience and get quickly fed up. I’m sure many of you have been there – forced to endure endless phone trees, explaining the problem to several different representatives before finally getting someone who can actually help solve the problem.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Today’s consumers want help immediately and efficiently, with zero inconvenience. Anything short of that will potentially cause the customer to defect to another retailer who can quickly and conveniently help them. Who can blame them? Inconvenience is irritating.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>HUMANS HAVE ADAPTED</strong></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">As technology has evolved, consumers have learned that they don’t need a live person to help them, most of the time. Technology has also trained consumers to have little patience with a poor customer experience, such as excessive hold times, imperfect communication skills, and any lack of helpfulness. Today’s customers feel that the world is at their fingertips and they no longer have to do business with any specific company.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">This is how the world is evolving. Knowing that, it would be a wise move to carefully examine how easy it is for customers to do business with your dealership. Responsiveness, helpfulness, and engagement are more important than ever. Make it easy and convenient for all customers to interact with your dealership. Ensure that when they need you, you are there and can help – right then, with no delay – in whatever way the customer wishes to interact with you.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Anything less than that and you may just find your customer moving on to your competition.</p>
&nbsp;
<div class="col-sm-4">[wpdevart_poll id="3" theme="1"]</div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Customer Service: Your Customers Aren’t Gonna Take It Anymore]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>

		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="convenience"><![CDATA[convenience]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="conversational-commerce"><![CDATA[conversational commerce]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="customer-interaction-management"><![CDATA[customer interaction management]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="customer-service"><![CDATA[customer service]]></category>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wpas_done_all]]></wp:meta_key>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_jetpack_dont_email_post_to_subs]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>myKaarma and MDL autoMation Announce Partnership and Integration</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/mykaarma-mdl-automation-announce-partnership-integration/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 22 Nov 2016 19:16:54 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ujj.nath@mykaarma.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://mykaarma.com/?p=2385</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>LONG BEACH, Calif., and ATLANTA, GA</strong> -- November 22, 2016 -- <strong>myKaarma</strong>, the cloud based conversational commerce software that’s revolutionizing the auto service industry and <strong>MDL autoMation</strong> (MDL – formerly MyDealerLot), a leader in RFID and License Plate Recognition (LPR) technology, today announced a partnership and integration to help streamline and improve the auto service customer’s experience. The integration pairs myKaarma’s internal and customer-facing messaging with MDL’s automated arrival technology to help auto dealers further improve communication and interaction with service customers.

“MDL continues to partner with leading companies that provide high-value technologies to auto dealer sales and service operations. Our integration with myKaarma uses our award-winning Service Drive Concierge™ platform to message a variety of events (customer arrival, vehicle wash, loaner returns) using RFID or License Plate Recognition Technology directly to myKaarma to enhance the service customer’s experience to increase sales and retention,” said George Cresto, MDL Founder and CEO.

As soon as a customer pulls into the service drive MDL transmits the VIN to the myKaarma system and a message is immediately sent to the assigned service advisor, notifying them that a customer has arrived. If desired, a message can also be texted to the customer welcoming them to the dealership. myKaarma can also send a message to the customer when their vehicle is completed in the car wash. Additionally, a message can be sent to the service department when a customer returns with their loaner. This improves communication and interaction with service customers as well as the overall speed and efficiency of the service transaction, resulting in happier customers.

“Responsiveness, helpfulness and engagement are more important than ever in retaining today’s customers. If it is not a fast, pleasant and easy experience for service customers when interacting with your dealership, the customer will go elsewhere,” said Ujj Nath, CEO of myKaarma. “We designed our platform to be the cleanest channel that connects customers with the dealer. Our integration with MDL further improves how dealers can interact with and maintain good communication with their customers, ensuring improved CSI and higher profits, Nath added.

For more information, or to schedule a product demonstration, visit www.mdlautomation.com or www.mykaarma.com

# # # # #
About MDL autoMation: (MDL)

Formerly known as MyDealerLot, MDL is the country's leader in providing process improvement through Instant Guest Recognition &amp; Messaging using Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) technologies and now LPR technologies. MDL systems are installed in leading U.S. dealerships enabling a 'Ritz Carlton' level of service, increased customer retention, improved CSI, and sales opportunities. MDL's Bluetooth beacon solution Bloodhound™ and RFID Zonal Tracking enable complete asset tracking of both Service and Inventory vehicles. MDL's web-based Dispatch Master effectively manages the movement operation of guest or inventory vehicles. See www.mdlautomation.com for more information.
MDL Media Contact:
Jennifer Breza

jbreza@mdlautomation.com 888-635-7343

About myKaarma:

myKaarma is a conversational commerce software company for automotive dealerships that focuses on enhancing the retail service department experience. myKaarma's platform gives dealers the ability to offer their customers 21st Century technology through digital conversations and smart payment systems. myKaarma was named as an official communications and payments partner for Mercedes-Benz USA.

myKaarma Media Contact:

Thomas Ross tom.ross@mykaarma.com
562.349.1356]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>If there were only more time</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/if-there-were-only-more-time/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 28 Nov 2016 20:17:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ujj.nath@mykaarma.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://mykaarma.com/?p=2426</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="font-weight: 400;">Between endless meetings, work-related tasks, and familial responsibilities it probably seems as if you’re continuously pulled in different directions. Our society has devolved into a place where we often fail to stop and notice important things, simply because we’re so busy satisfying the needs and wants from those we love, or to those whom we have to answer.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">A</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> perfect illustration</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> of how distracted our society has become is a wonderful story about internationally acclaimed virtuoso Joshua Bell, one the nation’s greatest violinists, commanding  fees upwards of $1,000 per minute performing to sold out crowds. He also loves to play anonymously in the D.C. Metro during rush hour. What is amazing is that during 43 minutes of playing, only one person recognized him and he made just $32.17 in tips.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">Today, people are so busy wrapped up in their own lives that many don’t want any intrusion – even if that intrusion is one of beauty and song – and they simply don’t listen. This is exactly why consumers get so annoyed when telemarketers or your salespeople call in the middle of dinner.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">We cannot make more time. We can only do the best with what we have. Because of that, people get annoyed when salespeople intrude on that time. So how do the Amazons, Apples, and Googles of the world continue to thrive and win the hearts and minds of their customers? It’s all about providing interactions the way the customer needs and desires.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">Would it surprise you if I told you that</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Amazon Prime members</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> now outnumber non-Amazon Prime members? Yes, a majority of customers are willing to pay a company $99 per year to do business with them. Why? It’s all about convenience.</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">Consumer behavior now dictates which companies thrive, which merely survive, and which disappear. Consumers have – and will always have – the leverage to make these decisions. And that leverage lies directly in their perception of your company; if you provide an excellent customer experience and make it convenient to do business with you and save them time….</span>

<span style="font-weight: 400;">… Or do you intrude upon it? It’s your choice. How do you interact with your customers and wish to be perceived?</span>

[wpdevart_poll id="4" theme="1"]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[If there were only more time]]></excerpt:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Reliability Could Be Your Dealership’s Downfall</title>
		<link>https://mykaarma.com/reliability-dealerships-downfall/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 06 Dec 2016 06:59:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ujj.nath@mykaarma.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://mykaarma.com/?p=2438</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Not too long ago, your service department could rely on seeing customers fairly frequently, but as vehicles have increased in quality, so have the OEM’s suggested service intervals – some are now as much as 15,000 miles between oil changes.

To put this into perspective, in the past, if a customer drove 15,000 miles annually they would visit the dealership on average five times per year. The dealership had five opportunities to recommend additional services and build relationships with the customer. You no longer can count on having as many opportunities to wow customers or pick up additional service business.

So, what do many dealers do? Increase messaging and inundate customers with phone calls, emails, texts and direct mail.

There seems to be a futile focus on trying to bring the customer back after he or she has left the dealership. What this means is that the dealer feels obligated to bombard the consumer with messages via email, direct mail, and phone calls...all of which seem to guarantee just one thing ...that the customer is going to ignore you!

With diminished opportunities, consider reviewing your messaging and be more careful and strategic about the messages you send. While getting the initial visit may have been easy, keeping the customer is becoming more and more difficult as they become used to increased vehicle reliability along with greater competition from other independent service centers in the marketplace, enticing them away with offers of lower prices and greater convenience.

While increased vehicle reliability may decrease opportunities, the wise dealer can capitalize on this by being ready to service their customers when they demand it. And, if you provide ways for the customer to interact with your dealership by their preferred method – be it text, phone, chat or email -- you can still achieve loyalty and increased customer retention.

Customers must know that your dealership is available to them when they need it and will assist them with their vehicle needs at their convenience – not the dealership’s. Keep that in mind the next time you feel like telling a customer you can’t service their car when they want it serviced.

&nbsp;

[wpdevart_poll id="5" theme="1"]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Reliability Could Be Your Dealership’s Downfall]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2438</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2016-12-05 22:59:23]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2016-12-06 06:59:23]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[reliability-dealerships-downfall]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="automotive"><![CDATA[automotive]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="car-service"><![CDATA[car service]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="communication"><![CDATA[communication]]></category>

		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="fixed-ops"><![CDATA[Fixed Ops]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="kaarma"><![CDATA[kaarma]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="mykaarma"><![CDATA[mykaarma]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="oem"><![CDATA[OEM]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="opinions"><![CDATA[Opinions]]></category>

		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="repair"><![CDATA[repair]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="retention"><![CDATA[retention]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="text-messaging"><![CDATA[text messaging]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="welcome"><![CDATA[welcome]]></category>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[6]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
